docs.title: Welcome to the Cobbleloots mod Documentation
docs.text:
Work in Progress

This documentation is currently a work in progress. Some sections may be incomplete or missing, or may contain incorrent information due to the use of artificial intelligence in its generation. If you can't find what you're looking for, please ask for help in the Discord server.

The official documentation for Cobbleloots. Here you will find guides, tutorials, and references to help you understand the mod and its features.

docs.title: Getting Started
docs.text: To get started with Cobbleloots, download the mod from CurseForge or Modrinth and install it using your preferred mod loader (NeoForge or Fabric).

docs.title: Features
docs.text: The mod introduces the Loot Balls, which are entities that can be found in the world or obtained through various means. When opened, these Loot Balls will give players random items based on predefined loot tables.

docs.title: Loot Balls
docs.text: Loot balls are special entities in the Cobbleloots mod that can be found in the world or obtained through various means. When opened, these Loot Balls will give players random items based on predefined loot tables.

docs.title: Types of Loot Balls
docs.text:
Cobbleloots features several types of Loot Balls, each with its own unique appearance and loot table. The types of Loot Balls include:

Ball Type Description Poké Loot Ball The most common type of loot ball, found almost everywhere Great Loot Ball An uncommon loot ball with better loot chances Ultra Loot Ball A rare loot ball with even better loot chances Master Loot Ball The rarest loot ball with the best loot chances Luxury Loot Ball A loot ball with a touch of elegance and style Dive Loot Ball A loot ball often found near water or underwater locations Heal Loot Ball A loot ball that brings restorative or healing items Safari Loot Ball A loot ball with items suited for exploration and adventure Rainbow Loot Ball A rare loot ball with colorful and unique rewards

docs.title: Azure Loot Ball
docs.text: The Azure Loot Ball is a variant of the Poké Loot Ball in the Cobbleloots mod. It contains a unique set of items based on its loot table.

docs.title: Details
docs.text: Property Value Name Azure Loot Ball Rarity Common XP on Open 1 Texture cobblemon:textures/poke_balls/azure_ball.png Loot Table ID cobbleloots:loot_ball/azure

docs.title: Obtaining
docs.text: Source Weight Filters/Restrictions Notes Generation 100 None Can generate anywhere Spawning 100 None Can spawn anywhere

docs.title: Loot Table
docs.text: Item Weight Count cobblemon:exp_candy_xs 1 5 minecraft:emerald 2 2–4 cobblemon:revive 4 1–2 cobblemon:ether 8 1–2 cobblemon:potion 8 1–3 minecraft:baked_potato 8 4–8 cobblemon:oran_berry 8 2–4 cobblemon:azure_ball 10 1

docs.title: Dive Loot Ball
docs.text: The Dive Loot Ball is an uncommon loot ball in the Cobbleloots mod, found in water biomes or underwater. It contains a variety of aquatic and treasure-themed items based on its loot table.

docs.title: Details
docs.text: Property Value Name Dive Loot Ball Rarity Uncommon XP on Open 5 Texture cobblemon:textures/poke_balls/dive_ball.png Loot Table ID cobbleloots:loot_ball/dive

docs.title: Obtaining
docs.text: Source Weight Filters/Restrictions Notes Generation 30 Biome Tag: cobbleloots:loot_ball/diveFluid: minecraft:water Can generate in ocean biomes Spawning 30 Biome Tag: cobbleloots:loot_ball/diveFluid: minecraft:water Can spawn in ocean biomes

docs.title: cobbleloots:loot_ball/safari
docs.text:
Description:

This biome tag is used for the Safari Loot Ball and includes all biomes that are considered savanna by Cobblemon.

Includes:

  • #cobblemon:is_savanna

Usage Example:

This tag is referenced by the Safari Loot Ball for both generation and spawning, restricting it to savanna biomes.

docs.title: cobbleloots:loot_ball/rainbow
docs.text:
Description:

This biome tag is used for the Rainbow Loot Ball and includes a selection of colorful or rare biomes.

Includes:

  • minecraft:mushroom_fields
  • minecraft:flower_forest
  • minecraft:meadow
  • minecraft:sunflower_plains
  • minecraft:warm_ocean
  • minecraft:cherry_grove

Usage Example:

This tag is referenced by the Rainbow Loot Ball for both generation and spawning, restricting it to these special biomes.

docs.title: cobbleloots:loot_ball/luxury
docs.text:
Description:

This biome tag is used for the Luxury Loot Ball and includes all biomes that are considered End biomes by Cobblemon.

Includes:

  • #cobblemon:is_end

Usage Example:

This tag is referenced by the Luxury Loot Ball for both generation and spawning, restricting it to End biomes.

docs.title: cobbleloots:loot_ball/dive
docs.text:
Description:

This biome tag is used for the Dive Loot Ball and includes all biomes that are considered oceans by Cobblemon.

Includes:

  • #cobblemon:is_ocean

Usage Example:

This tag is referenced by the Dive Loot Ball for both generation and spawning, restricting it to ocean biomes and requiring the presence of water as a fluid.
